alert.note: Alert for Mobile (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 19 at 3:21PM CDT until June 19 at 6:30PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Alabama, including the following county, Mobile. * WHEN...Until 630 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 321 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Midtown Mobile, Downtown Mobile, Prichard, Chickasaw, Semmes, Tanner Williams, Mobile Regional Airport, I10 And I65, I65 And I165, Orchard, Wheelerville, West Hill, Forest Hill, Seven Hills, Dawes, Eight Mile, Tacon, Mann, Whistler and Navco.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
